text:
How are people managing the renaming of template files when using the `watch` command? If I leave it as default, the renamed template is uploaded as a new file and the old file remains on the HS account.

If I use the `--remove`  flag then the new file is uploaded and the old one is deleted, but now any web page based on that template is disconnected.

Whereas if I rename the template in the Design Tools, everything remains connected.

Hey Paul, we do have an issue to support moves/renames with the CLI: <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/223>

But, I want to make sure you know about being able to add a `label` in the file metadata annotations, like <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/blob/master/src/templates/home.html#L4>

This label can be changed freely independent of the files name/path, which means you can have a nice and descriptive label for content creators selecting templates, and a more general file name.

Hi William, thanks for letting me know, it did seem really counterintuitive but at least you are aware. But yes I suppose the label is a good work around, but it’s nice to be able to pick the file from it’s name too.

Is the problem only with templates, or any files that are uploaded?
Hello, Is the file `.hsignore` working well? whenever I upload the theme I don't see the roles being applied.
